channel.title: coroutines on Brighton Kotlin
channel.description: Recent content in coroutines on Brighton Kotlin

item.title: Apache Pulsar with Kotlin coroutines and flows with Michele Sollecito
item.description: Come and join us by signing up on our meetup page: https://www.meetup.com/brighton-kotlin/events/294227622/ We are very excited to welcome Michele Sollecito to our July meetup. He will be giving a talk on Apache Pulsar with Kotlin coroutines and flows Event Format: Hybrid Join us in-person: 6:00pm @ Pizza Pilgrims, Brighton Join us online: 6:30pm on YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JbeK486FTyU We’ll explore how Kotlin makes consuming and producing messages from/to Apache Pulsar easy. We’ll look at some tests, and discuss how coroutines and flows work great with this kind of reactive and event-driven use cases.

item.title: Getting ready for Declarative UIs with Unidirectional Data Flow using Kotlin Coroutines by Raul Hernandez Lopez
item.description: The June Brighton Kotlin meetup takes place on Thursday 27th June at 6 pm GMT. We will be opening zoom just before 6pm for people to gather and chat. The link will be sent out on the day of the talk. The event will begin around 6pm. We’ll be welcoming our third speaker - Raul Hernandez Lopez who will give a talk called Getting ready for Declarative UIs with Unidirectional Data Flow using Kotlin Coroutines

item.title: A Fresh Look at Kotlin Coroutines by Laksitha Ranasingha
item.description: The June Brighton Kotlin meetup takes place on Thursday 27th June at 6 pm GMT. We will be opening zoom just before 6pm for people to gather and chat. The link will be sent out on the day of the talk. The event will begin around 6pm. We’ll be welcoming Laksitha Ranasingha who will take a fresh look at Coroutines: Ok, Kotlin is cool and fun. It’s even better with built in coroutine support.

item.title: Getting into the Flow with Coroutines By Joseph Van De Wee
item.description: Hot topics at KotlinConf, Coroutines and Flow provide an efficient way to handle asynchronous data streams. In this talk Joe will explore how we can use some of the basics from these APIs to provide fluid experiences for our users and avoid callback hell in our code. Heâ€™ll point out some of the common pitfalls along and way and look at how we can migrate from RxJava to Flow for reactive programming in Kotlin.
